description: "I don't believe that we have the luxury of writing in candidates' names, particularly in swing states," former Congresswoman Liz Cheney said.
title: Liz Cheney says she's voting for Kamala Harris

description: At least four people were killed, including two students and two teachers, in a shooting at a high school in Winder, Georgia. The suspect, a 14-year-old student, is in custody and will be charged as an adult, officials said. CBS News' Jared Eggleston is on the scene.

description: U.S. Steel's stock plunged as much as 25% amid a report that President Biden will seek to formally block its $14.1 billion deal with Japan's Nippon Steel.

description: The Georgia Bureau of Investigations says at least four people are dead and at least nine people are injured after a shooting at Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia, Wednesday. CBS News' Dave Malkoff has the latest, and Katherine Schweit, a former FBI agent, breaks down what's next in the investigative process.

title: At least 2 dead, multiple injured after Georgia high school shooting, sources say

description: There are reports of injuries and potential fatalities after a shooting at Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia. CBS News crime and public safety coordinating producer Anna Schecter has more as the White House and law enforcement officials weigh in on the shooting.

title: The best screens for Apple CarPlay and Android Auto

description: The Georgia Bureau of Investigation says one person is in custody in connection to a shooting at Apalachee High School in Barrow County, Georgia. Kathy Guider, a retired FBI agent, joins CBS News with more on what students may encounter during an active school shooting.
title: 1 in custody after Apalachee High School shooting in Georgia, officials say

description: Do weight loss drug labels warn enough about potential side effects? A patient who needed emergency surgery is suing prescription drugmaker Novo Nordisk.

description: One suspect was taken into custody after the shooting at Apalachee High School, the Georgia Bureau of Investigation confirmed.
title: 2 dead, multiple injured after school shooting in Georgia, sources say

description: Ralph de la Torre, the CEO of Steward Health Care, says he will not testify at a Senate hearing in Washington next week.
title: Steward CEO Ralph de la Torre won't testify before Senate panel

description: U.S. Department of Justice charges Hamas leaders in Oct. 7 attack; Billboard releases its top songs of each summer.
title: 9/4: CBS News 24/7 Episode 1

description: With two months until Election Day, neither major candidate has released the results of a recent physical exam.
title: Trump, Harris haven't released recent medical records as Election Day nears

description: Nearly seven years after 72 people were killed in the fire at London's Grenfell Tower, a retired judge who headlined an inquiry into the blaze says the deaths were all avoidable. The investigation into the fire has revealed failures by the U.K. government, building contractors and first responders. BBC correspondent Ellie Price has more.
title: Grenfell Tower fire inquiry points to failures by U.K. government, contractors and first responders

description: A blackmail email scam relies on public information, using a person's name, address and even a street view image of where they live.
title: How to protect yourself against blackmail email scams

description: The Biden administration is debating changes that would make it harder to lift the sweeping asylum restrictions it enacted in June, two officials tell CBS News.
title: Biden administration weighs making it harder to end asylum crackdown

description: Solo dining reservations are up 8% this year, according to data compiled by Open Table, and the average solo diner is spending about $84. Stephen Zagor, restaurant consultant and adjunct assistant professor at Columbia Business School, joined CBS News to discuss the trend.
title: More diners are eating out alone

description: The Navy sailor was visiting the country on personal travel, two U.S. officials said.
title: U.S. Navy sailor detained in Venezuela, officials say

description: The U.S. is set to accuse Russia of an interference campaign targeting the 2024 U.S. elections.
title: U.S. to accuse Russia of interference campaign in run-up to 2024 election

description: American Paralympian Oksana Masters took home her first medal of the Paris Games on Wednesday, winning gold in the women's para cycling time trial.
title: USA's Oksana Masters wins Paralympic gold in para cycling time trial

description: Kylie Jenner said she chose her son's name, Wolf, in haste and instantly regretted it, ultimately changing it to Aire. Regret occurs in other parents, too.
title: Nearly 1 in 10 moms regret their baby's name, survey finds

description: Animal rights groups said they had filed a complaint with Norwegian police asking them to open a "criminal investigation."
title: Mysterious death of "Russian spy" whale takes unexpected turn

description: Nearly 200,000 children in Gaza have been vaccinated against polio as part of a massive campaign as aid workers try to prevent the disease from spreading among kids. Doctors Without Borders medical team leader Dr. Naina Bhalla joined CBS News to discuss the efforts.
title: Gaza doctor describes childhood polio vaccination efforts

description: Solid August job numbers when DOL releases its monthly employment data on Friday should allay any fears of hard landing amid September volatility, analysts say.
title: Stocks rebound from morning slump following Wall Street's worst day in a month

description: Vice President Harris to present small business tax plan in New Hampshire; Jannik Sinner and Danil Medvedev face off in quarterfinal at U.S. Open.
title: 9/4: CBS Morning News

description: LL Flooring, once North America's largest specialty seller of hardwood floors, is closing its doors after 30 years in business.
title: LL Flooring, formerly Lumber Liquidators, is closing after 30 years

description: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba resigned Wednesday morning ahead of an expected cabinet shakeup by President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Kuleba's resignation also comes as Russia continues its onslaught of deadly missile strikes across Ukraine. CBS News foreign correspondent Ramy Inocencio has more.
title: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba resigns

description: Record-breaking heat is plaguing the western United States this week with Southern California battling excessive heat warnings and Phoenix seeing its 100th straight day of 100-degree weather. CBS News Los Angeles reporter Tina Patel has more on the conditions and Weather Channel meteorologist Jim Cantore has a look at the forecast.
title: Record-breaking temperatures hit western U.S. in late summer heat wave

description: To lose weight, millions of Americans have turned to prescription medications that treat diabetes like Wegovy, Ozempic and others. However, some say they can have serious side effects. CBS News senior investigative consumer correspondent Anna Werner spoke to a Pennsylvania woman who is warning others about rare complications she said she experienced from a weight loss drug that she says left her fighting for her life.
title: Woman says she suffered a medical emergency after taking popular weight loss drugs

description: Spain's Civil Guard said both people were taking a trail that leads through a small canyon to the sea when the storm hit.
title: British woman found dead, man missing after flood hits Mallorca

description: Vice President Kamala Harris is unveiling her planned initiatives for small businesses Wednesday at a campaign rally in New Hampshire while former President Donald Trump will deliver an economic address Thursday in New York. CBS News' Nidia Cavazos and Taurean Small have the latest from both campaigns.
title: Harris, Trump talking economics on campaign trail

description: Ukrainian officials say a Russian missile strike on the western city of Lviv killed seven people. It also shows the risk of the war's proximity to NATO land.
title: NATO member Poland scrambles jets as Russia attacks western Ukraine

description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals, Elizabeth Werner shows us items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage of these exclusive deals today. CBS earns commissions on purchases made through cbsdeals.com.
title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals

description: After nearly two decades representing over 300 of the biggest names in sports, Molly Fletcher has transitioned into a successful keynote speaker and author. She joins "CBS Mornings" to talk about her new book, "Dynamic Drive: The Purpose-Fueled Formula for Sustainable Success."
title: Former sports agent Molly Fletcher on new book

description: The FBI's Internet Crime Complaint Center saw more than 880,000 complaints last year, a 10% increase from 2022. Dan Ackerman, editor-in-chief of Micro Center News, joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss the rise of these threats.
title: Online scams reach new heights as FBI reports record surge

description: A former top aide to New York Gov. Kathy Hochul and the state's former Gov. Andrew Cuomo was arrested and is accused of acting as a foreign agent for China. The FBI has charged Linda Sun with subtly advancing Chinese interests in exchange for millions of dollars.
title: Former aide to New York Govs. Hochul, Cuomo accused of acting as foreign agent to China

description: Outrage in Israel continues as protesters carrying photos of hostages demand a cease-fire deal from its government. In an address to the nation, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed not to "give in to pressure." Meanwhile, President Biden has suggested that Netanyahu is "not doing enough" to come to a cease-fire deal. Warning: This story contains disturbing images.
title: Mass demonstrations continue in Israel as protesters demand cease-fire in Gaza war

description: Pope Francis, 87, has begun a mammoth 12-day tour of Southeast Asia and Oceania, testing his stamina after a series of health troubles.
title: Pope appears sprightly after health issues with epic Asia trip underway

description: As unrest continues in Israel with a stalled cease-fire deal, the U.S. Department of Justice unsealed charges against Hamas leaders for their involvement in the October 7 attack. Also, Vice President Harris outlines more of her economic plan on the campaign trail. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: DOJ unseals charges against Hamas leaders for October 7 attack

description: Mortgage interest rates could soon fall again. Here are four ways experts say you should prepare now.
title: How to prepare for lower mortgage interest rates, according to experts

description: In December, Lesley Stahl spoke with Alon Gat about his sister, Carmel, who was kidnapped by Hamas on October 7. At the time, Alon pleaded for his sister's safe return and told 60 Minutes about how she helped other hostages in Gaza by teaching them yoga. Carmel was one of six hostages killed by Hamas last week.
title: Remembering Israeli hostage Carmel Gat

description: A hospital in Oregon faces a new lawsuit over a nurse who was accused of replacing patients' prescribed fentanyl with tap water in intravenous drips.
title: Hospital sued after nurse accused of replacing fentanyl with tap water

description: At least seven people were killed in Lviv, Ukraine, in a Russian strike overnight. It follows another attack that killed dozens of people on Tuesday. Warning: This story contains disturbing images.
title: At least 7 killed in Ukraine in latest Russian strike

description: Wall Street took a hit Tuesday on the first day of trading in September, which historically is one of the worst months for the market. CBS News business analyst Jill Schlesinger explains the market slowdown and what to expect from Friday's job report.
title: Fears of an economic slowdown surface again as stocks tumbled Tuesday

description: Vice President Kamala Harris plans to unveil ideas designed to make life easier for small business owners. Her announcement comes as polling continues to give former President Donald Trump the advantage among voters when they're asked who can better handle the economy.
title: Harris to unveil economic vision as polls give Trump an advantage with voters on the economy

description: U.S. federal prosecutors have filed criminal charges against six senior leaders of Hamas, citing the deaths of at least 43 American citizens who were among 1,200 people killed on Oct. 7.
title: U.S. charges Hamas leaders with deaths of Americans

description: An inquiry into the 2017 Grenfell Tower fire in London that killed 72 people says U.S. company Arconic hid the dangers of its building materials.
title: Grenfell Tower fire probe finds U.S. firm "deliberately concealed" risks

description: Pope Francis met with Indonesian religious and political leaders during part of his historic trip through southeast Asia, urging them to fight against religious intolerance. CBS News' Anna Matranga has more.
title: Pope Francis meets with Indonesian leaders

description: At least seven people were killed Tuesday night in Ukraine as Russia continued its assault across the country. BBC News correspondent Nick Beake has more from Poltava, Ukraine, where more than 50 people were killed Wednesday by Russian missiles.
title: Deadly Russian strikes on Ukraine continue

description: A pre-taped town hall with former President Donald Trump will air on Fox News Wednesday night. CBS News campaign reporter Taurean Small has more on that and the latest news from the Trump campaign.
title: Trump town hall to air Wednesday night

description: Benjamin Netanyahu faces soaring anger over his handling of the war with Hamas, with hostages and Gaza's children caught in the crossfire.
title: Deadly Israeli strikes continue in Gaza as Netanyahu faces rising fury

description: Vice President Kamala Harris will unveil more of her plans to grow the economy, including a tax proposal for small businesses, during a campaign event in New Hampshire Wednesday. CBS News campaign reporter Nidia Cavazos has more.
title: Kamala Harris to present small business plan in New Hampshire

description: Trial began in Florida Tuesday of four activists accused of illegally acting as Russian agents to help the Kremlin sow political discord and interfere in U.S. elections.
title: Trial begins of 4 accused of helping Russia sow political division in U.S.

description: Cameron Yaste, commanding officer of the USS John McCain, was seen in a photo firing a rifle with a scope mounted backward.
title: Navy warship commander relieved of duty after embarrassing photo

description: Four Las Vegas teenagers have pleaded guilty to voluntary manslaughter in the fatal beating of their high school classmate as part of a deal with prosecutors that kept them from being tried as adults.
title: 4 Las Vegas teens plead guilty in classmate's deadly beating

description: As climate change brings more extreme weather, farmworkers who pick California grapes say they need more protections from extreme heat and wildfire smoke.
title: Federal officials tout extreme heat protections, but workers want more

description: Two Phoenix officers were shot by someone suspected of breaking into a vehicle, police said Tuesday. One was in critical condition and the other was stable. A suspect was in custody.
title: 2 Phoenix officers shot, one critical, the other likely saved by vest

description: Throughout history, there have been several notable spills -- oil in the ocean, molasses in Boston, and the New York Times reminds us Tuesday of the legacy of the Great Lego Spill of 1997.
title: Why Legos have been washing up on U.K. shores for decades

description: Tennis fans are flocking to Queens, New York, in record numbers to grab seats at the 2024 U.S. Open tournament. The tournament last week saw more than 75,000 fans on average per day.
title: U.S. Open sees record attendance numbers

description: Tipping feels like a growing part of our daily life, and the numbers support this. According to the payroll processing firm Gusto, 6.5% of American retailers currently accept tips, which is nearly twice the amount recorded in 2019. Michael Lynn, a professor at the Cornell School of Hotel Administration, joins to discuss.
title: Americans experiencing "tipping fatigue"

description: The last time a far-right party won an election in Germany, President Franklin D. Roosevelt signed the New Deal, and the world saw the creation of FM radio. On Monday, a new far-right group made gains in the country after state elections.
title: Far-right party in Germany wins state election

description: We're just about two months away from Election Day, but in some states, legal fights over the race have already started. In Georgia, the Republican-controlled State Election Board has passed a rule that will allow election officials to conduct "reasonable inquiries" before certifying results. Democrats are suing to block it, arguing that the bar for these "reasonable" inquiries isn't clearly set and could allow any one board member to block the certification of election results for any reason. CBS News election law contributor David Becker joins to discuss.
title: Are GOP lawsuits laying groundwork to challenge the 2024 election?

description: All four victims were passengers on a Blue Line train as it was headed into the Forest Park terminal when they were shot shortly before 5:30 a.m.
title: Suspect charged in killing of 4 sleeping people on CTA Blue Line train

description: A judge sentenced a Maryland man to 13 months in prison Tuesday for threatening and harassing members of Congress via phone. CBS News congressional correspondent Scott MacFarlane has more on growing threats against lawmakers.
title: How lawmakers are dealing with increasing threats

description: A bus tour promoting Vice President Kamala Harris' support for reproductive rights is underway after kicking off in Palm Beach, Florida, Tuesday. Meanwhile, former President Donald Trump has released a new photo book called "Saving America." Wall Street Journal political correspondent Molly Ball and Washington Post politics reporter Sabrina Rodriguez join to discuss the latest campaign developments.
title: Breaking down Harris' reproductive freedom tour, Trump's new book

description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom declared a state of emergency in Rancho Palos Verdes Tuesday after power was shut off to hundreds of residents as a slow-moving landslide accelerates following two years of heavy rain. CBS News correspondent Jonathan Vigliotti reports.
title: Slow-moving landslide imperils California city after wet winters

description: Later this week, voters in North Carolina will begin casting the first absentee ballots of the 2024 presidential election, though Election Day is still about two months away. CBS News chief Washington correspondent Major Garrett has more.
title: Harris and Trump hit campaign trail ahead of next week's debate

description: Ukrainian officials confirmed Tuesday that Russian airstrikes destroyed a military academy in the eastern town of Poltava, killing more than 50 people. It appears to be one of the deadliest strikes carried out by Russia since it began its invasion over two years ago. CBS News foreign correspondent Ian Lee has the latest.
title: Ukraine reports major increase in Russian air attacks

description: The U.S. has indicted six senior Hamas leaders over their involvement in the Oct. 7 attack on Israel. Hamas' top leadership is accused of planning, supporting and praising the attacks, according to a criminal complaint from the Justice Department. Attorney General Merrick Garland said Tuesday the Justice Department "has a long memory" and will continue pursuing "the terrorists responsible for murdering Americans." Jon Alterman, senior vice president at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, joins to discuss.
title: Garland on indictment of Hamas leaders: "These actions will not be our last"

description: The San Francisco 49ers said Ricky Pearsall was shot in the chest. Pearsall's mother said on social media that a single bullet entered through the right side of his chest and exited out of his back, missing vital organs.
title: Teen charged with attempted murder in shooting of 49ers rookie Ricky Pearsall

description: U.S. District Judge Alvin Hellerstein's ruling upends the Republican presidential nominee's plan to move the case to federal court.
title: Federal judge rejects Trump's request to intervene in "hush money" case
